com.optimizely.ab.android.sdk

Class OptimizelyClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.optimizely.ab.android.sdk.OptimizelyClient

  • public class OptimizelyClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Wraps Optimizely instances This proxy ensures that the Android SDK will not crash if the inner Optimizely SDK failed to start. When Optimizely fails to start via OptimizelyManager.initialize(Activity, OptimizelyStartListener) there will be no cached instance returned from OptimizelyManager.getOptimizely(). By accessing Optimizely through this interface checking for null is not required. If Optimizely is null warnings will be logged.

      • setForcedVariation

        public boolean setForcedVariation(@NonNull
                                  java.lang.String experimentKey,
                                  @NonNull
                                  java.lang.String userId,
                                  @Nullable
                                  java.lang.String variationKey)
        Force a user into a variation for a given experiment. The forced variation value does not persist across application launches. If the experiment key is not in the project file, this call fails and returns false. If the variationKey is not in the experiment, this call fails.
        Parameters:
        experimentKey - The key for the experiment.
        userId - The user ID to be used for bucketing.
        variationKey - The variation key to force the user into. If the variation key is null then the forcedVariation for that experiment is removed.
        Returns:
        boolean A boolean value that indicates if the set completed successfully.

      • getForcedVariation

        @Nullable
public com.optimizely.ab.config.Variation getForcedVariation(@NonNull
                                                                        java.lang.String experimentKey,
                                                                        @NonNull
                                                                        java.lang.String userId)
        Gets the forced variation for a given user and experiment. The forced variation value does not persist across application launches. It is runtime only.
        Parameters:
        experimentKey - The key for the experiment.
        userId - The user ID to be used for bucketing.
        Returns:
        The variation the user will be bucketed into. This value can be null if the forced variation fails.

      • addNotificationListener

        @Deprecated
public void addNotificationListener(@NonNull
                                                 com.optimizely.ab.notification.NotificationListener listener)
        Deprecated. 
        Add a NotificationListener if it does not exist already.

        Listeners are held by weak reference and may automatically be garbage collected. You may need to re-register them, for example if your Activity subclass implements the listener interface, you will need to re-register the listener on each onCreate.

        Parameters:
        listener - listener to add
